labelLink.label: Multicurrency Detail

Structure to provide additional information related to home currencies that differ from original currencies and related exchange rates - typically this will be used to record exchange rates and amounts in currencies and/or on dates other than those of the original transaction. This structure allows recording of exchange rates using a third currency as a triangulation currency. This is often EUR but is not restricted to being so. This structure may be repeated as many times as necessary to record amounts in foreign currencies on the same or different dates.
Foreign to Local Currency Conversion
Triangulation to Local Conversion
Foreign to Triangulation Conversion
Amount
The amount after currency conversion, expressed in the target currency.
Currency
The currency in which the converted amount is expressed, identified using the ISO 4217 currency code.
Exchange Rate
The exchange rate used for conversion, expressed as the amount of local (or functional) currency per unit of the target currency.
Exchange Rate Source
The source from which the exchange rate was obtained, such as a financial information provider (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg).
Exchange Rate Type
The type of exchange rate used, such as spot rate, forward rate, or other applicable rate classifications.
Exchange Rate Date
The date on which the exchange rate was applied or became effective for the conversion.
Exchange Rate Description
An optional comment providing additional context or clarification regarding the exchange rate or conversion process.
